metadata.title: CVE-2024-0646 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - high
metadata.description:
An out-of-bounds memory write flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™sTransport Layer Security functionality in how a user calls a functionsplice with a ktls socket as the destination. This flaw allows a local userto crash or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-0646` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-1004-oem - 6.1.0-1032.32
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.2').
linux-hwe-6.2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.5').
